title: Smoky BBQ Jackfruit Sandwiches
ingredients: 1 (20 ounce) can young green jackfruit in water or brine, drained and rinsed
1 cup vegan BBQ sauce (store-bought or homemade)
Salt and black pepper to taste
Optional toppings: coleslaw, pickled onions, vegan mayonnaise
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add drained jackfruit to the skillet and use two forks to shred it. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Stir in BBQ sauce, vegetable broth, smoked paprika, and liquid smoke (if using). Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the jackfruit is tender and flavorful. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Lightly toast the burger buns. Fill each bun with a generous portion of the BBQ jackfruit. Add your favorite toppings, such as coleslaw, pickled onions, or vegan mayonnaise.
description: These smoky BBQ jackfruit sandwiches are a delicious and satisfying vegan take on a classic American favorite. The jackfruit is shredded and simmered in a flavorful BBQ sauce, creating a tender and smoky filling that's perfect for piling high on toasted buns.
